section.title: Overview
section.p: The Taxation Profile entity includes multiple percentage tax rates and applicability conditions. The tax is applicable only to a monetary type of bucket and rate is mandatory for the taxation applied to a monetary resource. If the taxation reference is not provided in the charging service tariff rule, then the taxation cannot be applied. The taxation information cannot be retrieved from a bundle or account.
Nokia recommends not to change the tax or rate in between calls or for an ongoing session.

The taxation can be attached to a bundle, account, or lifecycle to implement the tax. However, taxation is not applicable for refund cases. The CDR tags generated for taxation are applicable on committed and reserved values.
The taxation can also be defined for the following lifecycle actions when the fee is used:

li.p: Charge Fee Action: If the taxation reference is not given within the lifecycle, which means the taxation profile is not given within the Charge Fee Action, then no tax is applied.

Add Subscription Action: If the taxation reference is not given within the lifecycle, which means the taxation profile is not given in the Add Subscription Action, then the tax related information is retrieved from bundle or account.

Renew Subscription Action: If the taxation reference is not given within the lifecycle, which means the taxation profile is not given in the Renew Subscription Action, then the tax related information is retrieved from bundle or account.

note.p: NCC charging uses the CEIL rounding method only for taxed amount.

The default applicability condition for taxation is true.

section.title: Configuring rule expressions
section.p: The rule expressions can be configured using roaming, zoning, call type so on to the special taxation Id to determine whether the taxation is applicable or not. If the criteria check of the taxation matches, then while reserving the amount from account or monetary bucket for the call, NCC uses the tax rate percentage (if exists). The Taxation fee = committed fee * tax rating percent. If there are multiple tax rate percentages, then the summary of all the tax rates are taken as taxation fee, that is, Taxation fee = committed fee * per tax rating percent. The committed fee plus the total taxation fee is charged to the account or monetary bucket.
CEIL rounding method is used for taxed amount. CEIL takes the number and rounds it to the nearest integer value above its current value. For example, the ceiling of 2.31 is 3.

The account balance is 200 USD attached to an iPhone device. Tax2 and Tax3 are provided in tariff.

p.b: Case 1: Data call at home location

sectiondiv.p: iPhone makes a data call from USA. The committed charge is 50 USD. Tax2 matches and is used for the committed usage. After closing the data call, the taxed amount charged is 57.5 USD = 50 * (1+5%+10%). The current account balance is 142.5 USD.

p.b: Case 2: Data call at roaming location

sectiondiv.p: iPhone makes a data call at roaming location. The committed charge is 80 USD. Tax3 matches and is used for the committed usage. After closing the data call, the taxed amount charged is 104 USD = 80 * (1+10%+15%+5%). The current account balance is 38.5 USD.
The account balance is 200 USD. In the lifecycle Charge Fee Action, the taxation Id Tax1 is attached with fee 100 USD. After execution of this action, the account balance is 90 and 110 is deducted.
